Harcourt, Brace & World, Inc.
757 THIRD AVENUE, NEW YORK 17, N.Y. 572-5000 CABLE: HARBRACE
April 3, 1964
Mr. James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 36, D. C.
Dear Mr. Fellows:
This letter is in reply to your request of
March 12th for permission to reprint "A.E.F." by Carl Sandburg for
distribution to radio listeners of the Voice of America broadcast
to overseas countries and in countries where local radio stations
may receive the taped programs through the United States Information
Agency. (We understand that Mrs. Kroll has already granted you
permission to broadcast "A.E.F.)
You may have our permission for this publication
of "A.E.F." and for its publication in a study booklet to be produced
by the United States Information Agency. The only condition we impose
is that the following copyright credit be printed as a footnote on the
page on which the poem appears:
From SMOKE AND STEEL by Carl Sandburg, copyright, 1920, by
Harcourt, Brace & World, Inc.; copyright 1948 by Carl Sandburg.
Reprinted by permission of the publishers.
Sincerely yours,
Permissions Department
